issue.title: Gazebo8 plot crash while viewing joing velocity

content.raw:
It could be related to the vector holding the points on the plot graph.

I am unable to reproduce this on Xenial though.
content.html:
It could be related to the vector holding the points on the plot graph.

I am unable to reproduce this on Xenial though.

issue.title: Gazebo8 plot crash while viewing joing velocity

content.raw: I can't reproduce this either. I'm moving this to gazebo 8.1
content.html: I can't reproduce this either. I'm moving this to gazebo 8.1

issue.title: Gazebo8 plot crash while viewing joing velocity
Gazebo8 plot crash while viewing joing velocity

content.raw:
I experienced a crash of Gazebo default on Ubuntu Xenial while using the plot tool, which looks similar. Error message:
~~~
[Err] [GuiIface.cc:120] ASSERT failure in QVector<T>::operator[]: "index out of range", file /usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu/qt5/QtCore/qvector.h, line 397
~~~
or (rarely)
~~~
[Err] [GuiIface.cc:120] ASSERT: "isDetached()" in file /usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu/qt5/QtCore/qvector.h, line 551
~~~

I have observed the crash regardless of whether plotting joint angle, joint velocity, pose, or velocity. The crash time varies for the same model/plot/scenario, though it usually occurs after 10s of seconds of plotting. I have not yet observed a crash while plotting a fixed or linear variable (e.g. ground plane z position or simulation time) or for `RelWithDebInfo` Gazebo builds. I reproduced the crash with default and gazebo8 (8.1.1) with `Debug` builds.

My procedure was to start Gazebo with the simulation paused, insert a double pendulum snapped to the origin, set up a plot of the lower link's z position, and then unpause the simulation.

Backtrace:
~~~
Thread 1 "gzclient" received signal SIGABRT, Aborted.
0x00007ffff4f5d428 in __GI_raise (sig=sig@entry=6) at ../sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/raise.c:54

(gdb) list

    at /usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu/qt5/QtCore/qvector.h:397

content.html:
I experienced a crash of Gazebo default on Ubuntu Xenial while using the plot tool, which looks similar. Error message:

[Err] [GuiIface.cc:120] ASSERT failure in QVector<T>::operator[]: "index out of range", file /usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu/qt5/QtCore/qvector.h, line 397

or (rarely)

[Err] [GuiIface.cc:120] ASSERT: "isDetached()" in file /usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu/qt5/QtCore/qvector.h, line 551

I have observed the crash regardless of whether plotting joint angle, joint velocity, pose, or velocity. The crash time varies for the same model/plot/scenario, though it usually occurs after 10s of seconds of plotting. I have not yet observed a crash while plotting a fixed or linear variable (e.g. ground plane z position or simulation time) or for RelWithDebInfo Gazebo builds. I reproduced the crash with default and gazebo8 (8.1.1) with Debug builds.

My procedure was to start Gazebo with the simulation paused, insert a double pendulum snapped to the origin, set up a plot of the lower link's z position, and then unpause the simulation.
